body_html:
@coosh-ed What distro (and what version) are you using?

@uray10 Yes, that means you won't be able to use distributed. It sounds like the test we do for ibverbs availability is not sufficient. Do you have the ability to install ibverbs in some way? For example, on Ubuntu, the package is named libibverbs
body_text:
@coosh-ed What distro (and what version) are you using?
@uray10 Yes, that means you won't be able to use distributed. It sounds like the test we do for ibverbs availability is not sufficient. Do you have the ability to install ibverbs in some way? For example, on Ubuntu, the package is named libibverbs
body:
@coosh-ed What distro (and what version) are you using?

@uray10 Yes, that means you won't be able to use distributed. It sounds like the test we do for ibverbs availability is not sufficient. Do you have the ability to install ibverbs in some way? For example, on Ubuntu, the package is named `libibverbs`
